section.title:
work orders scheduling by item group
item groups work order schedule details for Work Order Schedule by Item Group
section.para: To view Work Order schedules by Item Group, select the "Work Order Schedule by Item Group" option. The following screen will appear:

mediaobject.caption: Work Order Schedule by Item Group

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When displaying Work Order schedules by Item Group, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Select to display Work Order schedules for all Item Groups.
Specify Item Group whose Work Order schedule you want to display.
Enter an Item Group pattern to select a range of Item Groups. Refine your search using Regular Expressions.
Work Orders scheduled on and after this date will be displayed.
Work Orders scheduled on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to display the Work Order schedule by Item Group for all Sites.
Specify Site whose Work Order schedule by Item Group you want to display.

varlistentry.term: Only Show Released and In-Process W/O"s

listitem.para: Select to display only released and in-process Work Order schedules. Selecting this option means only Work Orders whose Status is released ("R") or in-process ("I") will be displayed.

varlistentry.term: Only Show Top Level Work Orders

listitem.para: Select to display only top level Work Orders. Top level Work Orders are Work Orders that have not been created to meet the component demands of a parent Work Order.

Display lists Work Order schedules by Item Group, using the specified parameters. The start dates and end dates are color-coded for ease of use. Both dates will display in red type if the Work Order is not yet in-process and is also past due. Once a Work Order's Status is changed to in-process ("I"), the start date will automatically revert to black type.
Select to automatically update the display every five minutes.

section.para: To the far right and at the bottom of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to generate the display, using the specified parameters.
Runs the report associated with this screen.

note.para: If the status of a highlighted Work Order is "O," then the buttons at the bottom of the screen will be disabled. Work Orders must be exploded ("E") before these options are available.
